title: What is Antonio Pigafetta's first voyage around the world? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hello Marites Natcher, What is Antonio Pigafetta's first voyage around the world? In Antonio Pigafetta’s youth, he studied astronomy, geography and cartography. At the beginning of the 16th century he served on board the ships of the Knights of Rhodes. During Magellan’s voyage 1519 to 1522, Antonio Pigafetta was Magellan's assistant and kept a journal accounting for everything that interested him. It was the earliest written account about the precolonial Philippines. Regards, James.

The Venetian explorer Antonio Pigafetta (c. 1491 – c. 1531) was one of the men who joined Ferdinand Magellan on his expedition to the Spice Islands. It left Spain on September 20, 1519, and arrived back on September 6, 1522. Alas, of the approximately 240 (some sources give 270) men who began the voyage, only 18 or so made it home, one of whom being Pigafetta. Nevertheless, those 18 were the first people to circumnavigate the globe. As for their leader Magellan, on the April 27, 1521 in the Philippines, he was killed in a battle with the locals.
